intro: Manglietia thamnodes, commonly known as the Thai manglietia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers with a fragrant scent. The plant has broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces woody capsules as fruit. It is typically found in tropical rainforests and is valued for its ornamental qualities. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
